overview_of_class: This course introduces students to key themes in the anthropological study of religion. We will bring classic thinkers into conversation with more recent and experimental contributions to the anthropology of religion. We will scrutinize how critical concepts in the anthropology of religion may also help us to better understand secularism. Topics will include embodiment, charisma, ethics, language, belief, and materiality. Our readings will include ethnographic examples that span geographic terrain and religious traditions. Through an emphasis fieldwork methods and ethnographic writing, students will develop strategies for understanding the relationship between ethnography and theory.
name: Anthropology of Religion
subject: ANTHRO
